title: Coronation Street spoilers: Bernie and Chesney attack sex abuser Kel as the truth is revealed
text:
(Picture: Mark Campbell/MCPIX)

There are dramatic scenes ahead in Coronation Street, as a very public altercation between Bernie Winter (Jane Hazelgrove) and sex abuser Kel (Joseph Alessi) takes place — which results Chesney Brown (Sam Aston) also getting in on the action.

Kel’s arrival on the cobbles brought with it much delight for Bernie, as she believed his return would be her second shot at happiness.

However, Paul (Peter Ash) wasn’t so pleased, as Kel had groomed and sexually abused him when he was only 14 — something which Billy (Daniel Brocklebank) worked out for himself, and — after he did so — he pleaded with Paul to open up to his family about the abuse.

(Picture: Mark Campbell/MCPIX)

(Picture: Mark Campbell/MCPIX)

We know that Bernie will come to discover the truth about what Kel did to her son all those years ago, and that her rage will know no bounds, as — after Paul opens up to her about what Kel did, she refuses to believe him — that is, until she finds evidence that proves Kel is guilty.

However, the animosity will continue long after the truth outs, as upon spotting Kel in a shopping mall — working as a security guard — Bernie is overcome with rage once more and proceeds to attack him — causing a very public scene.

(Picture: Mark Campbell/MCPIX)

Kel refuses to back down, and thus he begins to fight back. However, Chesney intervenes and, upon coming to Bernie’s rescue, he delivers a thunderous punch which successfully knocks the sex abuser off his feet.

Will Kel get his comeuppance for what he did?

During an appearance on Lorraine, actor Joe said: ‘I have no idea [how long I have left], it is open-ended,’

‘The character I’m playing is finite, I’ll never be a regular on Corrie that’s sure.’

‘My role will come to an end,’ he confirmed, but not before there ‘will be a lot of fall out’.

(Picture: Mark Campbell/MCPIX)

Kel made his first appearance on Corrie back in September, and it didn’t take viewers long to work out what he did to Paul.

The pair have had several altercations — one of which left Kel in a coma — but the truth has remained hidden thus far, with Billy being the only one to have discovered what really happened.

It’s safe to assume that the Winter family will be horrified when they learn about the abuse Paul suffered at the hands of Kel, and the upcoming scenes demonstrate the clan seeking revenge on the abuser.

These scenes will air in November.
